nsVrRip2.name: nsVrRip2
nsVrRip2.contactinfo: Customer Support 1194 North Mathilda Avenue Sunnyvale, California 94089-1206 USA Tel: 1-800-638-8296 E-mail: customerservice@juniper.net HTTP://www.juniper.net
nsVrRip2.description: The MIB module to describe the RIP2 Version 2 Protocol

RouteTag.name: RouteTag
RouteTag.description: the RouteTag type represents the contents of the Route Domain field in the packet header or route entry

nsVrRip2GlobalsTable.name: nsVrRip2GlobalsTable
nsVrRip2GlobalsTable.description: A list of RIP2 Globals per VR.

nsVrRip2GlobalRouteChanges.name: nsVrRip2GlobalRouteChanges
nsVrRip2GlobalRouteChanges.description: The number of route changes made to the IP Route Database by RIP. This does not include the refresh of a route's age.

nsVrRip2GlobalQueries.name: nsVrRip2GlobalQueries
nsVrRip2GlobalQueries.description: The number of responses sent to RIP queries from other systems.

nsVrRip2GlobalVRID.name: nsVrRip2GlobalVRID
nsVrRip2GlobalVRID.description: Virtual Router ID. VRID range for system created VRs: [1-1024] and for user created VRs: [1025-2048]

nsVrRip2IfStatTable.name: nsVrRip2IfStatTable
nsVrRip2IfStatTable.description: A list of subnets which require separate status monitoring in RIP.

nsVrRip2IfStatEntry.name: nsVrRip2IfStatEntry
nsVrRip2IfStatEntry.description: A Single Routing Domain in a single Subnet.

nsVrRip2IfStatAddress.name: nsVrRip2IfStatAddress
nsVrRip2IfStatAddress.description: The IP Address of this system on the indicated subnet. For unnumbered interfaces, the value 0.0.0.N, where the least significant 24 bits (N) is the ifIndex for the IP Interface in network byte order.

nsVrRip2IfStatRcvBadPackets.name: nsVrRip2IfStatRcvBadPackets
nsVrRip2IfStatRcvBadPackets.description: The number of RIP response packets received by the RIP process which were subsequently discarded for any reason (e.g. a version 0 packet, or an unknown command type).

nsVrRip2IfStatRcvBadRoutes.name: nsVrRip2IfStatRcvBadRoutes
nsVrRip2IfStatRcvBadRoutes.description: The number of routes, in valid RIP packets, which were ignored for any reason (e.g. unknown address family, or invalid metric).

nsVrRip2IfStatSentUpdates.name: nsVrRip2IfStatSentUpdates
nsVrRip2IfStatSentUpdates.description: The number of triggered RIP updates actually sent on this interface. This explicitly does NOT include full updates sent containing new information.

nsVrRip2IfStatStatus.name: nsVrRip2IfStatStatus
nsVrRip2IfStatStatus.description: Writing invalid has the effect of deleting this interface.

nsVrRip2IfStatVRID.name: nsVrRip2IfStatVRID
nsVrRip2IfStatVRID.description: Virtual Router ID. VRID range for system created VRs: [1-1024] and for user created VRs: [1025-2048]

nsVrRip2IfConfTable.name: nsVrRip2IfConfTable
nsVrRip2IfConfTable.description: A list of subnets which require separate configuration in RIP.

nsVrRip2IfConfEntry.name: nsVrRip2IfConfEntry
nsVrRip2IfConfEntry.description: A Single Routing Domain in a single Subnet.

nsVrRip2IfConfAddress.name: nsVrRip2IfConfAddress
nsVrRip2IfConfAddress.description: The IP Address of this system on the indicated subnet. For unnumbered interfaces, the value 0.0.0.N, where the least significant 24 bits (N) is the ifIndex for the IP Interface in network byte order.

nsVrRip2IfConfDomain.name: nsVrRip2IfConfDomain
nsVrRip2IfConfDomain.description: Value inserted into the Routing Domain field of all RIP packets sent on this interface.

nsVrRip2IfConfAuthType.name: nsVrRip2IfConfAuthType
nsVrRip2IfConfAuthType.description: The type of Authentication used on this interface.

nsVrRip2IfConfAuthKey.name: nsVrRip2IfConfAuthKey
nsVrRip2IfConfAuthKey.description: The value to be used as the Authentication Key whenever the corresponding instance of nsVrRip2IfConfAuthType has a value other than noAuthentication. A modification of the corresponding instance of nsVrRip2IfConfAuthType does not modify the nsVrRip2IfConfAuthKey value. If a string shorter than 16 octets is supplied, it will be left- justified and padded to 16 octets, on the right, with nulls (0x00). Reading this object always results in an OCTET STRING of length zero; authentication may not be bypassed by reading the MIB object.

nsVrRip2IfConfSend.name: nsVrRip2IfConfSend
nsVrRip2IfConfSend.description: What the router sends on this interface. ripVersion1 implies sending RIP updates compliant with RFC 1058. rip1Compatible implies broadcasting RIP-2 updates using RFC 1058 route subsumption rules. ripVersion2 implies multicasting RIP-2 updates. ripV1Demand indicates the use of Demand RIP on a WAN interface under RIP Version 1 rules. ripV2Demand indicates the use of Demand RIP on a WAN interface under Version 2 rules.

nsVrRip2IfConfReceive.name: nsVrRip2IfConfReceive
nsVrRip2IfConfReceive.description: This indicates which version of RIP updates are to be accepted. Note that rip2 and rip1OrRip2 implies reception of multicast packets.

nsVrRip2IfConfDefaultMetric.name: nsVrRip2IfConfDefaultMetric
nsVrRip2IfConfDefaultMetric.description: This variable indicates the metric that is to be used for the default route entry in RIP updates originated on this interface. A value of zero indicates that no default route should be originated; in this case, a default route via another router may be propagated.

nsVrRip2IfConfStatus.name: nsVrRip2IfConfStatus
nsVrRip2IfConfStatus.description: Writing invalid has the effect of deleting this interface.

nsVrRip2IfConfSrcAddress.name: nsVrRip2IfConfSrcAddress
nsVrRip2IfConfSrcAddress.description: The IP Address this system will use as a source address on this interface. If it is a numbered interface, this MUST be the same value as nsVrRip2IfConfAddress. On unnumbered interfaces, it must be the value of nsVrRip2IfConfAddress for some interface on the system.

nsVrRip2IfConfVRID.name: nsVrRip2IfConfVRID
nsVrRip2IfConfVRID.description: Virtual Router ID. VRID range for system created VRs: [1-1024] and for user created VRs: [1025-2048]

nsVrRip2PeerEntry.name: nsVrRip2PeerEntry
nsVrRip2PeerEntry.description: Information regarding a single routing peer.

nsVrRip2PeerAddress.name: nsVrRip2PeerAddress
nsVrRip2PeerAddress.description: The IP Address that the peer is using as its source address. Note that on an unnumbered link, this may not be a member of any subnet on the system.

nsVrRip2PeerDomain.name: nsVrRip2PeerDomain
nsVrRip2PeerDomain.description: The value in the Routing Domain field in RIP packets received from the peer. As domain suuport is deprecated, this must be zero.

nsVrRip2PeerLastUpdate.name: nsVrRip2PeerLastUpdate
nsVrRip2PeerLastUpdate.description: The value of sysUpTime when the most recent RIP update was received from this system.

nsVrRip2PeerVersion.name: nsVrRip2PeerVersion
nsVrRip2PeerVersion.description: The RIP version number in the header of the last RIP packet received.

nsVrRip2PeerRcvBadPackets.name: nsVrRip2PeerRcvBadPackets
nsVrRip2PeerRcvBadPackets.description: The number of RIP response packets from this peer discarded as invalid.

nsVrRip2PeerRcvBadRoutes.name: nsVrRip2PeerRcvBadRoutes
nsVrRip2PeerRcvBadRoutes.description: The number of routes from this peer that were ignored because the entry format was invalid.

nsVrRip2PeerVRID.name: nsVrRip2PeerVRID
nsVrRip2PeerVRID.description: Virtual Router ID. VRID range for system created VRs: [1-1024] and for user created VRs: [1025-2048]
